way ahead of you lol
  i already saved it
  the only this is that im scared i wont hear the "voices" through the audio <german>
   
  thnk you amy!

Jody Cupp <bigrig309@...> wrote:
            Amy,
  If you don't have any raw audio that german broadcast wav I sent last night should work for you. :)
  Jody
   
    ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Sumption Frank 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, June 14, 2006 3:55 PM
  Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] evp
  

         First you have to hit the folder icon to open, and load a wav file for the raw audio. I usually use human speech as the raw audio, but music will work too, it has to be in .wav format. Then you hit the record button at the bottom of the window, then the yellow arrow at the top, and a box should open where you can type in a question. When you click ok in the question box, then EVPmaker should run. You�ll have to play with the �overlap� �z-cross� and �segments� ms setting to find what works best, and produces the easiest to hear voices. The voices come out distorted, and might take some practice to hear. 
  
   Frank
  
      
---------------------------------
  
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Amy Swanson
Sent: Wednesday, June 14, 2006 1:47 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] evp

  
          ok another question about evpmaker, when i use it i just hit record.....but there is also a "make evp" option! how should i be using this thing?

    i dont seem to get results from audacity with recording, but the playback and cleaning on it is great !

    amy

Sumption Frank <fsumption@...> wrote:

             I started with reading an article in Popular Electronics on EVP back in 1995. I tried one recording back then, didn�t get anything. I put the magazine away, and told my self I would try again later. In the magazine, they mostly just covered the white noise method. In 2000 I dug out the magazine, and tried EVP again, using white noise from the radio, and this time someone spoke to me. I�ve been hooked ever since. Using noise, and having to listen at high volume through headphones made my ears ring, so I started searching the web for other methods, and found EVPmaker. I used that program for a couple years, but kept getting messages relayed from spirits that couldn�t use the computer. So I decided to try to come up with a more universal method, and after a couple weeks of thinking about it, my present system kinda popped into my head, fully formed, all I had to do was build it. 

    I still used others methods, because there�s times when some of the methods don�t work, so I switch modes to keep getting the voices. Her at work I can use EVPmaker pretty consistently, but it hardly ever produces anything at home. 

     Frank
